statement.tex: \text{Find the integral of the function}\\ \dfrac{\sin^2 x}{1+\cos x} \,

step.context: \text{Are the following calculations and analysis correct?}
step.tex:
\begin{align} \dfrac{\sin^2 x}{1+\cos x} &= \dfrac{\sin^2 x}{1+\cos x} \times \left( \dfrac{ 1 -\cos x}{ 1- \cos x}\right) \\ &= \dfrac{\sin^2 x \, (1 - \cos x)}{1 - \cos^2 x} \\ &= \dfrac{\sin^2 x \, (1 - \cos x)}{\sin^2 x} \\ &= 1 - \cos x \end{align}\\
\therefore \int \dfrac{\sin^2 x}{1+\cos x} \, dx = \int \left( 1 - \cos x \right) \, dx
